file_content.text: Remember: A Jedi never stops learning. Even our wisest Masters continue to study and train in the ways of the Force.
Master Cassa is waiting for you.
Master Orgus speaks highly of you. He says you are the finest Padawan he has ever trained.
The Force flows through you. It gives you strength. You have the potential to be a great champion of our order.
But first, you must learn to focus your ability. You must choose which path you will walk.
The Jedi are defenders of the Republic. In this role, we must accept a harsh truth: To preserve peace, we must often be warriors.
Some warriors become scourges of evil, living weapons who serve the light. Others become stalwart defenders, guardians who protect and shield others.
What do you recommend for me, Master Nimi?
Which one is best?
Each style has merit. Sometimes we must strike hard and fast; other times, indomitable resistance serves our needs.
Transforming myself into a living weapon sounds like the path for me.
I prefer strength in combat.
Striking hard and fast is one way to defeat our enemies. Yet sometimes, indomitable resistance has value as well.
I see myself as a protector of others.
I prefer to defend others.
Indomitable resistance is often an effective strategy. Yet sometimes there is more value in striking hard and fast.
There is a time for speech. A time for action. Even a time for quiet meditation... like now.
I'm not sure I follow, Master Nimi.
Path? I don't understand.
I sense you have great wisdom to share with me.
I'm ready to learn.
Master Orgus mentioned your superior martial skills. However, he neglected to mention your admirable hunger for knowledge.
I'm not a Padawan anymore. My training ended on Tython.
I've chosen my path.
Knowledge is not finite. We must learn from birth until we become one with the Force.
Consider this decision carefully, for it will forever alter your destiny.
